text: Hey all, can some one please tell me how can i have a field that will have multiple values that can be checked and changed for different page? for an example, I have a field car parts and on every dynamic page I have different car parts that needs to be checked based on the page. any ideas??

I think as Chad mentioned, you can use multi-select column type. Each car row can have different parts selected in that column. To display as check boxes in the page, you can iterate the list of values from that column. Also you can get all the available values for that column using `hubdb_table_column`  HubL function and check it against the list retrived for each row.

Hey Gobi, I have tried to use multi select, but it doesn't solve my issue because for every car, the client can enter  different parts. I need a field where i can make a list for every car separately, i can not predefine them like
car1:motor,pump,wheel,
car2:manual, automatic, some simple text about the car,
car3:some other specific about the car

and all this to be shown as a check box on the dynamic page

Hey Chad, i cant use multi select because it doesnt solve my issue, i am trying to use the comma separated values, but the thing is that some of the content already have commas inside and that will mess up the text. any ideas?

i am new in HubSpot sorry, as i understand, i should make another table "car_parts" and inside i put text fields as much as i need, and then set a relationship to those tables? like primary id on the "car_parts" will be the id of the car?
will i then be able to show those properties in a list with checkboxes??
Pretty much. It's kinda like building another object inside of a column. Nearest objects you might say
mhmm ill try to find something but thanks for the guideline!
there is not much documentation for HubSpot development :S
